required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of IV Administration of Ketamine on the Analgesia Nociception Index (ANI) Measured With the PhysioDoloris
clinical_study.official_title: The Effects of Intravenous Administration of Ketamine on the Analgesia Nociception Index (ANI) Measured With the PhysioDoloris Device

brief_summary.textblock: This study evaluates effects of the analgesic ketamine on ANI measurements (Anti Nociceptive Index)

detailed_description.textblock:
Researchers at the University of Washington are doing this study to find out if a commonly used anesthetic affects patients Analgesia Nociception Index (level of pain relief) during abdominal hysterectomy under general anesthesia.
The investigators will administer routine anesthesia care including Ketamine, a commonly used anesthetic, during the patients surgery. During the patients surgery, the investigators will monitor the patients level of pain relief using the PhysioDoloris monitor, which monitors the routinely used EKG monitor. Though not yet FDA approved, the PhysioDoloris is completely non-invasive and collects data from the EKG monitor.

primary_outcome.description: ANI stands for Analgesia Nociception Index. Its a dimension less number computed by a pain monitor ranging from 0-100. An index of 100 means absent pain, and the number decreases as pain increases. ANI was measured pre- and post- Intubation

primary_outcome.measure: Mean ANI Changes 3 Min After Ketamine Bolus
primary_outcome.time_frame: Before vs 3 min after Ketamine adminstration
primary_outcome.description: ANI was measured pre- and post- i.v. ketamine administration

primary_outcome.measure: Mean ANI Changes 5 Min After Ketamine Bolus
primary_outcome.time_frame: Before vs 5 min after Ketamine adminstration
primary_outcome.description: ANI was measured pre- and post- i.v. ketamine administration

primary_outcome.measure: Mean ANI Changes After Skin Incision
primary_outcome.description: ANI was measured pre- and post- skin incision

secondary_outcome.description: BIS was measured pre- and post-intubation. BIS, Bispectral index, is an indication of anesthesia depth and measured by a monitor during surgery (0-100 scale, range described below). Depth of sedation is calculated by measuring cerebral electric activity via an electroencephalogram (EEG). 100-90: awake and responding appropriately to verbal stimulation 80-70: responsive to loud commands or mild shaking 60-40: unresponsive to verbal stimulus; general anesthesia obtained with a low chance for explicit recall <40: deep hypnotic state; possible protective responses still intact <20: burst suppression (EEG pattern characterized by cycles of high-voltage electrical movement alternating with cycles of no activity in the brain); respiratory drive is limited, but possible protective responses still intact 0: totally suppressed EEG (flat line)

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean BIS Changes 3 Min After Ketamine Bolus
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before vs 3 min after Ketamine adminstration
secondary_outcome.description: BIS was measured pre- and post-Ketamine administration. BIS, Bispectral index, is an indication of anesthesia depth and measured by a monitor during surgery (0-100 scale, range described below). Depth of sedation is calculated by measuring cerebral electric activity via an electroencephalogram (EEG). 100-90: awake and responding appropriately to verbal stimulation 80-70: responsive to loud commands or mild shaking 60-40: unresponsive to verbal stimulus; general anesthesia obtained with a low chance for explicit recall <40: deep hypnotic state; possible protective responses still intact <20: burst suppression (EEG pattern characterized by cycles of high-voltage electrical movement alternating with cycles of no activity in the brain); respiratory drive is limited, but possible protective responses still intact 0: totally suppressed EEG (flat line)

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean BIS Changes After Skin Incision
secondary_outcome.description: BIS was measured pre- and post-skin incision. BIS, Bispectral index, is an indication of anesthesia depth and measured by a monitor during surgery (0-100 scale, range described below). Depth of sedation is calculated by measuring cerebral electric activity via an electroencephalogram (EEG). 100-90: awake and responding appropriately to verbal stimulation 80-70: responsive to loud commands or mild shaking 60-40: unresponsive to verbal stimulus; general anesthesia obtained with a low chance for explicit recall <40: deep hypnotic state; possible protective responses still intact <20: burst suppression (EEG pattern characterized by cycles of high-voltage electrical movement alternating with cycles of no activity in the brain); respiratory drive is limited, but possible protective responses still intact 0: totally suppressed EEG (flat line)

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Heart Rate Change After Intubation
secondary_outcome.description: Heart rate assessed by continuous pulse oximetry. Heart rate was measured pre- and post-intubation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Heart Rate Change 3 Min After Ketamine Bolus
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before vs 3 min after Ketamine adminstration
secondary_outcome.description: Heart rate was measured pre- and post- Ketamine administration

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Heart Rate Change After Skin Incision
secondary_outcome.description: Heart rate was measured pre- and post-skin incision.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Mean Arterial Pressure After Intubation
secondary_outcome.description: MAP or mean arterial pressure is the average blood pressure of an individual and is measured non-invasively during surgery. MAP was measured pre- and post-intubation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Mean Arterial Pressure After 3 Min After Ketamine Bolus
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before vs 3 min after Ketamine adminstration
secondary_outcome.description: MAP was measured pre- and post-ketamine administration

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean MAP Changes After Skin Incision
secondary_outcome.description: MAP was measured pre- and post- skin incision.

other_outcome.description: Amount of Ketamine used during surgery

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- ASA status I, II, or III
- 18 years or older
- Receiving GA with uncomplicated routine intubation
- Ability to provide informed consent
- English-speaking
Exclusion Criteria:
- Presence of coronary artery disease, cardiac arrhythmias, or ketamine allergy
- Patient refusal
- History of substance abuse
- Patients taking psychotropic and/or opiate drugs
- Having a history of psychiatric diseases or psychological problems

participant_flow.recruitment_details: After institutional review board approval, this observational pilot study was conducted at the University of Washington Medical Center (UWMC). Twenty women, 18 years of age or older, of American Society of Anesthesiology Physical Status I-III scheduled for an abdominal hysterectomy under sevoflurane anesthesia were recruited.

group.title: Women, Scheduled for Abdominal Hysterectomy
group.description: Women 18 years of age or older, of American Society of Anesthesiology Physical Status I-III scheduled for an abdominal hysterectomy under general anesthesia

baseline.population: Twenty women, 18 years of age or older, of American Society of Anesthesiology Physical Status I-III scheduled for an abdominal hysterectomy under sevoflurane anesthesia were recruited.

group.title: Women Scheduled for Abdominal Hysterectomies.
group.description: Inclusion criteria : >18yrs, ASA 1-3, Scheduled for abdominal hysterectomies under general anesthesia

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
